title: Viral Sequencing, from Gunk to Graph

protocol.title: Viral Sequencing, from Gunk to Graph
protocol.title_html: Viral Sequencing, from Gunk to Graph

source.description:
Prepare a
centrifuge tube with heated lysis buffer and a cellulose disc

Collect sample using a sterile polystyrene swab with a 30mm breakpoint (e.g.
Puritan 25-3606-U; PurFlock Ultra 6" Sterile Elongated Flock Swab w/Polystryene Handle, 30mm Breakpoint
).

Add
lysis / RNAse inactivation buffer (
Twitter reference
) to 1.5ml centrifuge tube:
OR
extraction buffer #2 (see
paper
):

Add a
punched disc from
Whatman #1 filter paper
(see
paper
)

Preheat
tube to

Transfer disc to a new
tube containing
wash buffer using a pipette tip to remove contaminants:

Incubate tube at
for

Add the following additional components into the
PCR tube (see the
Nanopore protocol for Sequence-specific cDNA-PCR Sequencing (SQK-PCS109)
) in a
reaction:
x
x
Reverse primers should be prefixed with sample-specific barcode sequences (if used) and the ONT reverse anchor sequence, i.e. [5' - ACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTC - [barcode] - [sequence-specific] - 3']
Mix gently by flicking the tube and spin down

Denature RNA and anneal primers at
for
and then snap cool on a pre-chilled freezer block for

In a separate tube, mix together the following in an
reaction:
5X RT Buffer
RNAseOUT
Nuclease-free water
x
Strand-switching primer (SSP)
Note: It might be possible to instead carry out only the first-strand synthesis (i.e. excluding SSP), then use a forward primer, tailed with sample-specific barcode sequences (if used) and the ONT forward anchor sequence, i.e. [5' - TTTCTGTTGGTGCTGATATTGC - [barcode] - [sequence-specific] - 3']. One-Step RT-PCR sequencing kits may help with this (e.g.
OneTaq One-Step RT-PCR Kit
). For more details about the reverse anchor sequence and four-primer amplicon sequencing, see the Nanopore protocol for
Four-primer PCR (SQK-PSK004 or SQK-PBK004)
.
Mix gently by flicking the tube and spin down
Add the strand-switching buffer to the snap-cooled, annealed RNA, mix by flicking the tube and spin down

Incubate at
for

Add
of Maxima H Minus Reverse Transcriptase, to a total volume of
Mix gently by flicking the tube and spin down

Incubate using the following protocol:
ABCD
1Cycle stepTemperatureTimeNo. of cycles
2Reverse transcription and strand-switching42° C90 mins1
3Heat inactivation85° C5 mins1
4Hold4° C∞

ABCD
1Cycle stepTemperatureTimeNo. of cycles
2Reverse transcription and strand-switching42° C90 mins1
3Heat inactivation85° C5 mins1
4Hold4° C∞

In four new
PCR tubes, prepare the following reaction at
in a
reaction:
2X Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity Master Mix
cDNA primer (cPRM)
Nuclease-free water
Reverse-transcribed cDNA from the previous step (pool, or single sample)

Amplify using the following cycling conditions:
ABCD
1Cycle stepTemperatureTimeNo. of cycles
2Initial denaturation95 °C30 secs1
3Denaturation95 °C15 secs10-18*
4Annealing62 °C15 secs10-18*
5Extension65 °C50 secs per kb10-18*
6Final extension65 °C6 mins1
7Hold4 °C∞
* The recommended starting point is 14 cycles - adjust this depending on experimental needs.

ABCD
1Cycle stepTemperatureTimeNo. of cycles
2Initial denaturation95 °C30 secs1
3Denaturation95 °C15 secs10-18*
4Annealing62 °C15 secs10-18*
5Extension65 °C50 secs per kb10-18*
6Final extension65 °C6 mins1
7Hold4 °C∞

Add
of NEB Exonuclease 1 (20 units) directly to each PCR tube to remove unextended primers. Mix by pipetting.

Incubate the reaction at
for
, followed by
for

Add 160 µl of resuspended AMPure XP beads to the
tube and mix by pipetting

Incubate on a gentle agitator (e.g. hula mixer or rotator mixer) for
at

Spin down
the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.

Keep the tube on the magnet and wash the beads with
of freshly-prepared
without disturbing the pellet. Remove the ethanol using a pipette and discard.

Repeat the previous step: wash with
, and discard the ethanol / wash liquid.

Spin down
and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow to dry for
but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking (the magnetic beads should just start to lose their shiny sheen).

Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in
of Elution Buffer (EB).

Incubate at
for

Pellet beads on magnet
until the eluate is clear and colourless

While still on the magnet, carefully remove and retain
of eluate into a clean
Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube

Quantify 1 µl of the amplified cDNA library using the Quantus Fluorometer using the ONE dsDNA assay (see
ncov 2019 sequencing protocol, step 16
)

Add
of Rapid Adapter (RAP) to the amplified cDNA library
Mix by pipetting and spin down

Incubate the reaction for
at

Store the prepared library
until ready to load onto a flow cell.

Load
sequencing library onto a MinION flow cell (see
ncov 2019 sequencing protocol, step 21
)

Start the sequencing run using MinKNOW, using SQK-PCS109 as the sample preparation protocol
(see
ncov 2019 sequencing protocol, step 22
)

Analyse the run results using RAMPART (see
https://artic.network/ncov-2019/ncov2019-using-rampart.html
)

materials.name: Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix - 500 rxns

description: This is a fast "gunk to graph" protocol for analysing viral RNA from nasopharyngeal swabs. The approach involves swab lysis and inactivation at the point of sampling, uses a cellulose binding / wash protocol to reduce extraction cost, incorporates sample-specific barcodes during first-strand synthesis, nanopore rapid-attachment primers during PCR amplification, and nanopore sequencing with parallel RAMPART analysis for fast assembly and phylogenetics.
